message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DB, cs.OS, cs.CR, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper discusses the limitations of distributed storage systems in providing fast read transactions while ensuring consistency. This topic falls under the scope of several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC), Databases (cs.DB), Operating Systems (cs.OS), Cryptography and Security (cs.CR), and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). However, given the focus on distributed storage systems and consistency, cs.DC and cs.DB are the most likely categories. The paper also touches on replication and consistency levels, which further supports the relevance of cs.DC and cs.DB. The topics of operating systems and cryptography are less relevant to the paper's main focus, but they may still be relevant to some aspects of the paper's analysis. Finally, the topic of data structures and algorithms is less relevant to the paper's main focus, but it may be relevant to some of the technical details of the paper's proofs.
